thread.title: Soccer reporter gets hit by car during live broadcast
thread.title_full: Soccer reporter gets hit by car during live broadcast

author: Matt Birch
title: Soccer reporter gets hit by car during live broadcast
text:
Soccer reporter gets hit by car during live broadcast The Sports Daily 21 hrs ago Matt Birch © World News on YouTube A sports reporter was hit by a car while appearing on live TV. Television reporters have a difficult job to do. Not only do they have to come up with compelling questions during live interviews, but they also have to deal with players, coaches and fans trying to sabotage the broadcast in the form of a snarky answer, dirty look or videobomb.
AdChoices One unlucky FOX Sports reporter had all those things in check during a recent broadcast, but something that was completely out of his control abruptly ended his report.
David Medrano Mora was on scene outside Mexico’s Guadalajara International Airport to recap a match between Chivas and Club America that had recently ended and was being introduced by studio anchor Aldo Sanchez. But before Sanchez could finish talking, Mora was hit by a car.
As you can see, Mora looked over his shoulder roughly one second before he was struck but had no time to get out of the way. Luckily, Mora did not suffer any many injuries from the incident, according to Sam Matthew of the Daily Mail.
